derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: probably from Middle Dutch splissen, of unknown origin

entry.tran: 绞接(绳子);粘接(胶片、磁带等)
entry.def: If you splice two pieces of rope, film, or tape together, you join them neatly at the ends so that they make one continuous piece.

example.ex: He taught me to edit and splice film...
example.tran: 他教我剪辑和粘接胶片。

example.ex: The film will be spliced with footage of Cypress Hill to be filmed in America.
example.tran: 这部电影要和将在美国拍摄的柏树山乐队的音乐片段粘接在一起。

entry.def: When two people get spliced, they get married.

example.ex: An old friend of mine, newly spliced, recently invited me to dinner in his new marital home.
example.tran: 我的一位刚结婚不久的老朋友最近邀请我到他的婚房去吃晚饭。

means.word_mean: 1. a junction where two things (as paper or film or magnetic tape) have been joined together;

sentences.sentence: "the break was due to an imperfect splice"

means.word_mean: 2. joint made by overlapping two ends and joining them together
3. join together so as to form new genetic combinations;

stems_affixes.word_buile: avar渴望+ice行为,状态→渴望状态→贪心
capr山羊+ice行为,状态→像山羊一样乱蹦→任性
coward懦弱的人,胆小的人+ice行为,状态→n.胆小,懦弱
crev裂开+ice行为,状态→n.缺口,裂缝
mal坏+ice行为,状态→n.恶意;蓄意犯罪
spli=split分裂+ice行为,状态→由分裂反推成衔接

sentences.cn: 他把两段胶卷粘接起来。
